pronunciation: PREMED'ITATE [Latin proemeditor; proe, before, and meditor, to mediate.]

definition.text: To think on and revolve in the mind beforehand; to contrive and design previously; as, to premeditate theft or robbery.With words premeditated thus he said.PREMED'ITATE, verb intransitive To think, consider or revolve in the mind beforehand; to deliberate; to have formed in the mind by previous thought or meditation.PREMED'ITATE, adjective Contrived by previous meditation.
